intro: Cheilanthes niphobola, commonly known as the alpine rock fern, is a species of fern native to high-altitude regions of the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, thriving in cold, dry environments. Its fronds are leathery and dark green, with a dense, mat-like growth habit. Cheilanthes niphobola is well adapted to harsh alpine conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
